availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles W. Terry (Barren County, Kentucky, shoemaker)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, shoemaker. Kentucky native. Married to Mary J. Terry. Father of Sarah J. Terry, Brad Terry, and William A. Terry. Shoemaker with John Leach and Fielding Garnett in Barren County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Barren County in 1850. Shoemaker with Freeman Norris in Barren County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Barren County in 1860. Merchant in Barren County in 1864.

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, p. 6D.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Barren County, KY, February 1864, p. 153 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
